comments:
Tried running some plugins. Works fine on windows. On my linux
install (with both blackdown1.4.2 and SUN VM1.4.2_04) some of the plugins
throw an exception. The error seems to be generated from the SWT in not finding
the class sun.awt.X11.XEmbeddedFrame I checked the rt.jar and it doesnt have the
same. Is there any other jar which needs to be included? A log from one of the
plugins (metrics)

To support embedded Swing/AWT widgets in eclipse, you must use a 1.5 JVM.  On 
Windows, a 1.4.1 JVM is sufficient.

Please could you improve the error message? "XEmbeddedFrame not found" is pretty
cryptic. I spent half a day trying to fix this bug before finding this note.

Could you test the java version (e.g. when creating an SWT Display), then throw
a meaningful error message? Something like "Unsupported Java version detected:
SWT on Linux requires Java version 1.5 or above, SWT on Windows requires Java
version 1.4 or above".

SWT/AWT interop is just a small part of SWT. SWT in general (without SWT/AWT 
interop) runs in JDK1.1. Throwing an exception on startup (new Display) 
because SWT/AWT interop is not available is not an option, since many SWT 
users do not need SWT/AWT interop at all.

We change the code (>20050418) so that the exception thrown in 
SWT_AWT.new_Frame() will warn you about the JDK version. Something like

org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: Not implemented [need JDK 1.5 or greater] 
(java.lang.ClassNotFoundException) sun.awt.x11.XEmbeddedFrame)

I still see this problem in JVM 1.5 in Solaris machine. Is there any new 
status about it.

For some reason, the SWT_AWT native library is not being
built for Solaris/Motif, only for Solaris/GTK+.  I have filed
bug 114036 to track this issue.

I'm also still having this problem on Mac OS X when trying to load the metrics plugin.  I'm using java 1.5 and eclipse 3.1.  See Stack trace below...
